Keywords: Cosmic , Elders of the Universe
Real Name: Taneleer Tivan
Special Powers
OF COURSE IF THAT'S NOT YOUR STYLE: If you have at least one character of each rarity of Common, Uncommon, Rare, and Super Rare on your force, friendly characters modify attack +1.
THERE'S PLENTY MORE WE CAN PLAY WITH: At the beginning of the game, if each character on your starting force is from a different Heroclix set, as long as The Collector is on the map, friendly characters modify damage +1. Protected: Pulse Wave.
WHAT KIND OF BEING LEAVES A PARTY WITHOUT SAYING GOODBYE?: STOP. Super Senses.

Yes, the Collector counts, so he fills the "Disney+" slot on your team. And yes, you can only have one copy of each figure if you want to fulfill his second Trait.

June 9, 2022
Angel1995
THERE'S PLENTY MORE WE CAN PLAY WITH: At the beginning of the game, if each character on your starting force is from a different Heroclix set, as long as The Collector is on the map, friendly characters modify damage +1. How do we determine what counts as a set for the purposes of this trait? For the purposes of this effect, a set will be determined by the set symbol on the character’s base. Each set symbol must be different in order for Collector’s effect to apply. This means Fast Forces characters will be considered different from their main set characters since the set symbols are different. All exclusive figures have the WK (WizKids) set symbol, so they would all count as being from the same set. Legacy Card characters will use the set symbol printed on their base.
June 9, 2022
Angel1995
This are the rules for the collector fom wizkids For the purposes of this effect, the rarity of a character will be determined by the color of the set symbol on their base. White = Common Green = Uncommon Silver = Rare Gold = Super Rare Bronze = Chase, Limited Edition, & Exclusive Blue = Ultra Chase Bystanders are considered to have no rarity for the purposes of this effect. They will not count for or against the effect. This includes bystanders that may have a colored set symbol. All Legacy Card characters will be considered to be Limited Edition figures, regardless of the color of the set symbol on their base or card (if applicable). This means they will not count for or against the purposes of this effect.

I ask mostly for Master Mold.[/QUOTE] As far as I know, the only official marker of what set a figure is from is the set symbol, so I�d assume all the WKDs would be one set and all the WKMs another, regardless of year of release. Always a chance this sort of thing will get an official ruling that goes wildly differently, of course. I�d be more interested to hear how it interacts with Legacy figures. Guessing it would go by the set symbol on the legacy card, since that�s what determines their modern age status (or lack thereof).
